alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin; Sebastian (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 01 at 11:13AM CST until February 02 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO MIDNIGHT CST THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...A mixture of freezing rain, sleet and snow. Snow and sleet accumulation of 1 to 3 inches. Ice accumulations of one tenth to one quarter inch with isolated amounts to one half inch possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast Oklahoma and northwest and west central Arkansas. * WHEN...From noon Wednesday to midnight CST Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice especially across portions of southeast Oklahoma. Travel conditions will rapidly deteriorate late Wednesday afternoon and become hazardous Wednesday evening through early Thursday.
info.instruction: A combination of gusty winds and significant ice accumulation on trees and power lines will likely occur, especially across portions of southeast Oklahoma which would cause power outages. Do not touch downed lines and report any power outages to your electric company. If you use a generator, please follow appropriate safety guidelines. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. In Arkansas, for the latest road conditions call 1-800-245- 1672 or go to idrivearkansas.com. In Oklahoma, for the latest road conditions call 1-844-465-4997 or go to okRoads.org.
